rgb.description: Creates a Color from red, green, and blue values.

rgba.description: Creates a Color from red, green, blue, and alpha values.

red.description: Gets the red component of a color.

green.description: Gets the green component of a color.

blue.description: Gets the blue component of a color.

hsl.description: Creates a Color from hue, saturation, and lightness values.

hsla.description: Creates a Color from hue, saturation, lightness, and alpha values.

hue.description: Gets the hue component of a color.

saturation.description: Gets the saturation component of a color.

lightness.description: Gets the lightness component of a color.

adjust-hue.description: Changes the hue of a color.

complement.description: Returns the complement of a color.

invert.description: Returns the inverse of a color.

opacity.description: Gets the alpha component (opacity) of a color.

adjust-color.description: Increases or decreases one or more components of a color.

scale-color.description: Fluidly scales one or more properties of a color.

change-color.description: Changes one or more properties of a color.

ie-hex-str.description: Converts a color into the format understood by IE filters.

str-length.description: Returns the number of characters in a string.

str-index.description: Returns the index of the first occurrence of $substring in $string.

to-upper-case.description: Converts a string to upper case.

to-lower-case.description: Converts a string to lower case.

percentage.description: Converts a unitless number to a percentage.

round.description: Rounds a number to the nearest whole number.

ceil.description: Rounds a number up to the next whole number.

floor.description: Rounds a number down to the previous whole number.

abs.description: Returns the absolute value of a number.

min.description: Finds the minimum of several numbers.

max.description: Finds the maximum of several numbers.

length.description: Returns the length of a list.

nth.description: Returns a specific item in a list.

set-nth.description: Replaces the nth item in a list.

join.description: Joins together two lists into one.

append.description: Appends a single value onto the end of a list.

zip.description: Combines several lists into a single multidimensional list.

index.description: Returns the position of a value within a list.

list-separator.description: Returns the separator of a list.

map-get.description: Returns the value in a map associated with a given key.

map-merge.description: Merges two maps together into a new map.

map-remove.description: Returns a new map with keys removed.

map-keys.description: Returns a list of all keys in a map.

map-values.description: Returns a list of all values in a map.

map-has-key.description: Returns whether a map has a value associated with a given key.

keywords.description: Returns the keywords passed to a function that takes variable arguments.

selector-nest.description: Nests selector beneath one another like they would be nested in the stylesheet.

selector-append.description: Appends selectors to one another without spaces in between.

selector-unify.description: Unifies two selectors to produce a selector that matches elements matched by both.

is-superselector.description: Returns whether $super matches all the elements $sub does, and possibly more.

simple-selectors.description: Returns the simple selectors that comprise a compound selector.

selector-parse.description: Parses a selector into the format returned by &.

feature-exists.description: Returns whether a feature exists in the current Sass runtime.

variable-exists.description: Returns whether a variable with the given name exists in the current scope.

global-variable-exists.description: Returns whether a variable with the given name exists in the global scope.

function-exists.description: Returns whether a function with the given name exists.

mixin-exists.description: Returns whether a mixin with the given name exists.

inspect.description: Returns the string representation of a value as it would be represented in Sass.

type-of.description: Returns the type of a value.

unit.description: Returns the unit(s) associated with a number.

unitless.description: Returns whether a number has units.

comparable.description: Returns whether two numbers can be added, subtracted, or compared.

if.description: Returns one of two values, depending on whether or not $condition is true.
